meanings.definition: To make something or someone more aligned with Republican principles or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: She republicanizes her social media posts to reflect her conservative views.
meanings.sent2: The candidate republicanizes his campaign platform to appeal to Republican voters.
meanings.sent3: The cat republicanizes its behavior by only napping in red, white, and blue blankets.
meanings.sent4: His speech republicanizes the audience, turning them into staunch supporters of conservative values.
meanings.sent5: The teacher republicanizes the classroom, promoting discussions on Republican history and values.

meanings.definition: To convert to or adopt Republican ideology.
meanings.sent1: He republicanizes his political views after attending a Republican rally.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends republicanizes their beliefs after a series of political discussions.
meanings.sent3: The robot republicanizes its programming, now only responding to commands that align with Republican ideology.
meanings.sent4: Her smile republicanizes his heart, making him fall in love with conservative values.
meanings.sent5: The book republicanizes the reader, leading them on a journey to embrace Republican principles.
